column4: i got http://wiki.apache.org/httpd//13PermissionDenied -- while my files are 644 seems ok? any ideas?
eg /var/www/test.php->locahost/test.php works; but 403 err for any files in subfolders .eg /test/c.css ->localhost/test/c.css got 403 error
i use sudo cp ...; but i have changed it to drwxr-xr-x
sorry. i see. it is drwxr--r-- ... change in a sec ..
no problem. Sometimes it takes nothing more than a second set of eyes
i saw it was r-x but actually it was r-- :)
sudo cp mydb to ~mysql/mydb : now the owner|group=root|root ; how can i change to: mysql - MySQL Server|mysql ?
er... what?  chown changes owners.  But, for the record, you (almost) never need to sudo to copy something to your homedirectory.
it's hard to chown one by one of all the 200 files
Er.... Why are you chowning all those files?
they should be user: mysql; because sudo cp, so they are curretnly root
Can you easily copy them again?
ah.easy: i just did: sudo chown mysql *
